questions.questionText: Question 1: When suspicious email messages arrive in your inbox, you share the responsibility of protecting the organization as the last line of defense. So you can:

options.text: A. Reply to the sender address and blame their behavior
B. Report the Phish Alert to email server

questions.questionText: Question 2: What do you think is the primary threat for software developers?
Question 3: Which one of the following statements is false?

options.text: A. 3DES is more secure than DES in keeping confidentiality.
C. AES is the most secured among 3DES, DES and AES.
D.  DES is the slowest in encryption and decryption among 3DES, DES and AES.

questions.questionText: Question 4: Output of a system/program is dependent on the timing of other uncontrollable events. This will cause which of the following attacks:
Question 5: What is the solution to defend against rainbow attacks where attackers can create a table of password hashes and allow a reverse check-up in the table to find the original password?

options.text: C. Do not disclose which hashing algorithm is used
